content: I added an instance to my PR, but now I am having a linter error in an unrelated file. Can someone please help?

The error is:

Error: ././././Mathlib/RingTheory/Nullstellensatz.lean:178:1: error: @MvPolynomial.vanishingIdeal_zeroLocus_eq_radical LINTER FAILED:

simplify fails on left-hand side:

(deterministic) timeout at `typeclass`, maximum number of heartbeats (20000) has been reached

Use `set_option synthInstance.maxHeartbeats <num>` to set the limit.
Does set_option synthInstance.maxHeartbeats 40000 in before the failing declaration fix it? Somehow your instance might have pushed something over the edge.
I actually did this but with 50000. I ran the checks again but I'm still getting the same error message.
Are you seeing the same error locally? If so then you could set_option trace.Meta.synthInstance true and see if there are any suspicious looking loops in the trace.
I reverted the change from instance back to theorem and now everything works.

I have just tried again to trigger this issue locally (by changing the theorem back to an instance and compiling the Nullstellensatz file) and I simply cannot. I have no idea why CI is getting errors which I can't analyse because I can't reproduce :-/ Are there any settings which are being set in the CI run which I don't have locally? I'd happily look at traces to try and figure out what is happening but I need a failure first.
@Kevin Buzzard I suspect the error here is in the linting stage, so you shouldn't be trying to reproduce this issue in the Nullstellensatz file, but rather in a file with import Mathlib.
I'm wondering if anybody has thoughts on a better name for the noncomputable def nilradmaxlocalizationIsSelf. Perhaps localizationEquivSelfOfNilradicalIsMaximal?
